reference.shortdesc: Red Hat OpenShift Data Foundation (ODF) uses the ODF FlashSystem Operator and ODF FlashSystem Driver to integrate with your IBM FlashSystem storage system. When using the OpenShift Data Foundation with your storage system ensure that all configuration needs are met by following the Red Hat ODF documentation set.

section.p: The ODF FlashSystem Operator and ODF FlashSystem Driver enable IBM Spectrum Virtualize family products to be used with Red Hat OpenShift Data Foundation.

For more information and documentation, see the following:
Support summary for enabled IBM Spectrum Virtualize family products and Red Hat OpenShift Data Foundation: .
User information and release notes documentation for the Red Hat OpenShift Data Foundation: OpenShift Data Foundation documentation.
General information about the OpenShift Data Foundation, a software-defined storage for containers: OpenShift Data Foundation

section.title: Configuration considerations
section.p: When creating block storage persistent volumes, be sure to select the storage class <storage_class_name> for best performance. The storage class allows a direct I/O path to the FlashSystem storage system.

section.title: Limitations
section.p:
The ODF FlashSystem Operator and ODF FlashSystem Driver contain the following limitations:
Only one FlashSystem storage system can be connected to ODF at a time. Red Hat OpenShift can work with several FlashSystem storage systems simultaneously.
Only x86 architecture is supported.
When creating a storage class from within the Red Hat ODF user-interface, installation of Ceph RWO on FlashSystem storage systems is allowed. When working with FlashSystem storage systems, it is best to use a direct I/O path to the storage system. For more information, see .
Capacity calculations provide erroneous output values for child pools and external storage attachments.
The following individual reports are not currently generated:
Pool performance
Pool storage class capacity
Volume performance
Volume storage class capacity
Reports are not generated for FlashSystem information and events.
